6612: One morning you Woke up in a foreign country. Your hands tremble yet, you listen into yourself, but it will be you do not know what possessed you in this dead seaside town To thee scattered only the beginning are your papers shellfish and you feel the poisons in the system Want only the evening on stand As are holes under your skin you're made of sponge from your residence in depth you write letters to your friends, read each line ...
